# Boilerplate Dotfiles

> Cross-platform dotfiles managed with chezmoi and mise, supporting macOS (zsh) and Linux (bash). Provides automated setup, OS-aware templates, and comprehensive tool management for development environments.

This repository contains dotfiles and configuration managed via chezmoi. It uses mise for tool installation, supports both macOS and Linux, and includes configurations for zsh/bash, nvim, tmux, and various development tools.

## Documentation

### Core Skills (for AI Agents)

These skills provide actionable playbooks for working with this repository:

- [Apply Dotfiles](./home/dot_config/opencode/skills/apply-dotfiles/SKILL.md): Deploy and update dotfiles using chezmoi. Use for initial setup, applying changes, or syncing configuration.
- [Install Tools](./home/dot_config/opencode/skills/install-tools/SKILL.md): Install and manage software via mise. Use for adding CLI tools, updating versions, or managing language runtimes.
- [Maintain System](./home/dot_config/opencode/skills/maintain-system/SKILL.md): Update and maintain the entire system. Use for routine maintenance, upgrades, and health checks.

## Repository Structure

```
boilerplate/
├── home/                          # chezmoi source directory
│   ├── dot_config/
│   │   ├── mise/config.toml       # Tool definitions
│   │   ├── nvim/                  # Neovim configuration
│   │   ├── tmux/                  # Tmux configuration
│   │   ├── shell/common.sh        # Shared shell config
│   │   └── opencode/skills/       # AI agent skills
│   ├── dot_zshrc.tmpl             # Zsh configuration
│   ├── dot_bashrc.tmpl            # Bash configuration
│   └── run_once_*.sh.tmpl         # Setup hooks
├── setup                          # Bootstrap script
├── Brewfile                       # Homebrew packages
└── README.md                      # User documentation
```

## Key Technologies

- **chezmoi**: Dotfile manager with templating (https://chezmoi.io)
- **mise**: Universal tool manager (https://mise.jdx.dev)
- **Git**: Version control
- **Homebrew**: macOS package manager
- **zsh/bash**: Shell environments

## Quick Commands

```bash
# Initial setup
./setup

# Apply dotfiles
chezmoi apply

# Install tools
mise install

# Update system
chezmoi update && mise upgrade
```

## Repository Location

When working with this repository on a local system, the source is typically at:
`~/Documents/GitHub/boilerplate/`

The dotfiles source is in the `home/` subdirectory, configured via `.chezmoiroot`.
